title: Goa nightclub tragedy: Fire started by electric crackers; bodies found on top of each other
content: A devastating fire at Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub in Arpora claimed 25 lives, including five tourists, late Saturday night. The blaze, believed to have started from electric firecrackers igniting the wooden ceiling, trapped many in the basement, leading to suffocation. Authorities have registered a culpable homicide case against the club owners and arrested four staff members.

title: Did IndiGo 'waste time'? Govt probe to cover why airline delayed preps for new norms
content: A government panel is investigating IndiGo's alleged delay in preparing for new flight duty rules, potentially lobbying for exemptions instead. The probe will examine if this inaction, alongside other operational lapses, caused the recent flight crisis. The airline's failure to report preparedness and the DGCA's handling of the situation are also under scrutiny.

title: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma asked to 'treat differently' after South Africa ODIs
content: Former batting coach Sanjay Bangar strongly defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's place in the ODI team, citing their exceptional records. He argued that established stars, having retired from other formats, deserve time to regain match fitness and their presence significantly boosts team morale and confidence, especially after tough losses.

title: Netflix sends 'late night letter' to its 300 million subscribers
content: Netflix is acquiring Warner Bros. in an $82.7 billion deal, bringing HBO Max and HBO under its umbrella.  While assuring subscribers "nothing is changing today," the streaming giant anticipates a 12-18 month closing period.  Despite Netflix's assurances of a pro-consumer move, politicians and industry groups have raised significant concerns about potential price hikes and job losses.

title: Goa nightclub fire: NCR family vacay ends in grief; woman loses husband, 3 sisters
content: A family's Goan holiday turned tragic when a fire engulfed a nightclub, claiming four lives. Bhavana Joshi miraculously survived after her husband pushed her to safety before re-entering the inferno to save his sisters-in-law. The devastating incident left her the sole survivor, facing the grim task of informing their children of their parents' and aunts' untimely deaths.

title: Bigg Boss 19 winner: Gaurav Khanna lifts trophy; takes home Rs 50 lakh cash prize
content: Gaurav Khanna emerged as the Bigg Boss 19 winner, showcasing dignity and patience amidst house chaos. His calm approach, emotional intelligence, and unwavering self-control, exemplified by winning the Ticket to Finale task and receiving praise from Salman Khan, made him a respected contestant. Khanna's calculated gameplay and genuine bonds highlighted his integrity and inner strength, proving calmness can be revolutionary.

title: 'It's time ...': Wedding cancelled! What Mandhana and Palash said in their statements
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has confirmed the cancellation of her wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal, ending weeks of social media speculation. Both individuals have requested privacy for their families and expressed their desire to move forward. Muchhal also stated his team will take legal action against those spreading defamatory content.

title: Bill Gates' daughter gets $30M for AI app: Gates says won't invest; works helpdesk
content: Phoebe Gates' artificial intelligence shopping startup, Phia, has raised $30 million in new funding. This investment values the company at $180 million. Bill Gates, Phoebe's father, has supported the venture with his time and experience. Phia aims to make online shopping smarter and more sustainable. The app offers price comparisons, discounts, and secondhand options.

title: Trump ‘a little disappointed’ Zelenskyy hasn’t read US peace plan as Miami talks stall
content: US President Trump expressed disappointment that Ukrainian President Zelenskyy has not yet reviewed a peace proposal, while Russia has accepted it. Talks in Miami concluded with lingering territorial and security guarantee issues. Zelenskyy acknowledged the need for detailed discussions on proposals to end the conflict and prevent further Russian aggression.

title: 'Recipe for disaster': Why Delhi nightclubs are on knife’s edge
content: A devastating fire at a nightclub in Goa, claiming the lives of 25 people, has thrown a glaring spotlight on the inadequate fire safety measures in Delhi's entertainment spots. In spite of existing regulations, many venues suffer from overcrowded layouts, obstructed exits, and flammable decor, while maintenance seems to be a low priority.

title: IndiGo flight chaos: MLAs travel 12 hours by rail, road to reach Nagpur for session
content: Special trains will run from Nagpur to Mumbai on December 14 and 15 to help legislators return after the winter session, addressing IndiGo flight cancellations. The Maharashtra Legislative Council chairperson confirmed the arrangements, emphasizing the state government's request to the Railways. Matters concerning Vidarbha will be prioritized during the session.

title: ‘Metaverse’ budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
content: Meta is reportedly planning to significantly cut its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its virtual reality ambitions. This move follows substantial losses and a lack of consumer interest in its VR products. The company is now prioritizing its artificial intelligence initiatives.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection: Ranveer Singh starrer scores Rs 100 crore India opening
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has achieved a phenomenal opening week at the box office, exceeding trade expectations. The film delivered an explosive debut weekend, grossing Rs 119 crore domestically and over Rs 140 crore worldwide. This marks Ranveer Singh's career-best launch and a significant milestone for debutante Sara Arjun.

title: Rs 30 crore fraud case: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt, wife arrested in Mumbai
content: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his wife Shwetambari were apprehended in Mumbai early Sunday concerning a ₹30 crore fraud case filed in Udaipur. An IVF specialist accused them of inducing him to invest in a biopic, promising substantial returns that never materialized. The couple, along with others, faces charges, and police are investigating financial dealings.

title: Anna Kournikova & Enrique Iglesias net worth 2025: Career, earnings, biz
content: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: Grim theory on missing coach Travis Turner as veteran cop warns chilling clues
content: A missing Virginia football coach, Travis Turner, may never be found. He vanished from his home on November 20. Authorities charged him with child pornography offenses. A law enforcement expert states dense woods and wildlife make recovery difficult. Search teams are using advanced tools, but success remains uncertain. A reward is offered for information leading to his arrest.

title: LeBron James sends heartfelt 'family' message to fans after viral Toronto clip
content: LeBron James felt immense love from Toronto fans during the Lakers' recent game against the Raptors. The NBA legend, touched by the cheers and signs, called the fans "family" and expressed his deep appreciation for their unwavering support. He highlighted the special place Toronto holds in his heart, cherishing the warm welcome he always receives.

title: Rera to builders in Karnataka: Insure common areas or pay for disaster repairs
content: Karnataka Rera has raised the bar for construction standards by enforcing a policy that compels builders to secure insurance for communal areas, underlining their accountability for potential disaster recovery costs. Following a recent clubhouse fire, developers are now required to provide verifiable insurance documentation within a tight 30-day window.

title: Manish Tewari brings bill in Lok Sabha seeking to let MPs take their own voting line
content: Congress MP Manish Tewari has introduced a private member's bill in Lok Sabha to amend the anti-defection law. The proposed changes aim to allow MPs to vote independently on most bills and motions, except those affecting government stability. This move seeks to free parliamentarians from party whips and promote better lawmaking.

title: Dessert storm: Mithai marauders strike sweet shop 10 times in 9 years
content: A Nadiad confectionery has been repeatedly targeted by burglars, experiencing 10 break-ins in nine years. Thieves have stolen significant quantities of sweets, often in addition to cash. Despite owner Mukesh Pandit's efforts, including installing CCTVs, the burglaries continue, particularly during VVIP visits and festivals when police presence is reduced.

title: Goa fire: Night out becomes nightmare for Bengaluru youth; 20-yr-old woman suffers burns
content: A group of young tourists from Bengaluru experienced a holiday turned nightmare in Goa when a fire broke out during a club performance. A 20-year-old woman sustained severe burns and is undergoing treatment, while friends recounted the chaotic evacuation. A doctor couple from Mumbai also caught in the incident, with the husband receiving treatment for burns.

title: Palash Muchhal deletes proposal video, while Smriti Mandhana removes all photos with him
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal and cricketer Smriti Mandhana have officially called off their wedding, originally scheduled for November 24, 2025.  Following health scares for Smriti's father and Palash's hospitalization, the couple confirmed the decision in separate statements.  Muchhal has since deleted proposal videos and other shared memories from his social media.

title: IIT-Bombay steps into future with its own AI firm
content: IIT Bombay has incorporated BharatGen Technology Foundation, a company dedicated to building a Large Language Model reflecting India's diversity. This national sovereign AI effort, backed by significant government funding, aims to develop AI that understands over 22 Indian languages and provides accessible models for developers and enterprises.

title: CJI Surya Kant bats for tech-enabled jail reforms, UK-style monitoring
content: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant champions tech-driven prison reforms, advocating for digital skills training and UK-style inmate monitoring to transform correctional facilities into reintegration hubs. He stressed industry partnerships for apprenticeships and recruitment, aiming to equip inmates with future-ready skills and reduce recidivism through measurable rehabilitation.

title: Goa tragedy: No fire clearance for club, violated building norms too
content: A devastating fire at The Birch by Romeo Lane was attributed to critical failures in fire prevention, regulatory compliance, and life safety preparedness by club owners. The establishment lacked a construction license and a fire department NOC, with zero fire safety measures in place. Obstructed exits and hazardous external firework activities exacerbated the tragedy, trapping victims.

title: DTC driver beaten to death after jam due to wedding triggers spat
content: A DTC bus driver was beaten to death by wedding guests in Delhi after a road rage incident. The driver, Vikas, was allegedly assaulted when his bus got stuck behind a marriage procession. One suspect has been arrested, while three others remain at large.

title: Goa inferno: 'Island' club with narrow path leading to it made firefighting a challenge
content: A devastating fire at Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub in Arpora, Goa, claimed 25 lives, exposing severe infrastructure flaws. Built on a salt pan with limited access and inadequate safety measures, the venue's design, including a poorly ventilated basement and a single operational exit on the first floor, hampered rescue efforts. Investigations are underway into the club's safety protocols.

title: India, US line up high-level visits to advance cooperation
content: US under secretary Allison Hooker is in India from December 7-11 to bolster the strategic partnership. Her visit, encompassing New Delhi and Bengaluru, aims to deepen economic ties, boost American exports, and foster collaboration in emerging technologies like AI and space exploration. Discussions will cover bilateral cooperation and regional security, underscoring a commitment to a free and open Indo-Pacific.

title: Anamaria Goltes shares intimate details of her early relationship with Doncic
content: Luka Doncic and his fiancée Anamaria Goltes, childhood sweethearts who met at age 12, have welcomed their second daughter, Olivia. The couple, who began dating in 2016, maintain a private personal life while balancing demanding professional schedules and now live with their three dogs.  Anamaria Goltes and the Lakers’ star have dated each other for a very long period of time before getting engaged in the summer of 2023.

title: Tariffs to put 'America first': Is Trump spelling doom for US? Economics explained
content: President Donald Trump's "America First" tariff policy has led to record revenue collections, but economic data reveals Americans bear the brunt of the costs. Tariffs are increasingly passed on to consumers and businesses, raising prices and contradicting claims of foreign payment, if rules of economics are studies. This strategy creates a dilemma between political popularity and growing economic burdens on households.

title: Ladakh to Arunachal, Rajnath Singh inaugurates 125 border projects
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh inaugurated 125 border infrastructure projects, including the Shyok tunnel in Ladakh, at a cost of Rs 5,000 crore. These projects will enhance troop mobility, boost tourism and employment, and strengthen faith in democracy in remote regions. Singh highlighted their importance for security, economy, and disaster management, emphasizing connectivity as a backbone of national security.

title: Undoing Macaulay? Inside India’s decolonisation push towards ‘Bharat’ - explained
content: India is actively pursuing a decolonisation agenda, moving beyond English's historical dominance. This initiative, championed by PM Modi, aims to revive indigenous knowledge systems and promote regional languages in education and governance. While fostering national pride, concerns remain about potential Hindi imposition over linguistic diversity, sparking a crucial national dialogue.

title: Not Sachin or Kohli! 'We should be proud that he was born in our country'
content: Former Indian opener Murali Vijay lauded MS Dhoni's unique leadership and instinctive decision-making, citing the 2007 T20 World Cup final over to Joginder Sharma as a prime example. Vijay highlighted Dhoni's powerful hitting and mental strength, emphasising his unparalleled range and out-of-the-box approach that led to India's victory. Dhoni will continue with CSK in the IPL until 2026.

title: Tom Hicks, former owner of Stars, Rangers and Liverpool FC, dies at 79
content: Texas businessman Tom Hicks, renowned for his ownership of the Dallas Stars, Texas Rangers, and investment in Liverpool FC, has passed away at 79. His tenure saw the Stars win the Stanley Cup and the Rangers reach the World Series. Hicks's significant impact on sports and private equity leaves a lasting legacy.

title: Smriti Mandhana & Palash Muchhal's wedding cancelled: Full timeline of events
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has officially confirmed her wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal is off, ending weeks of speculation. She requested privacy for both families, stating her focus is now on representing India.  Calling herself a “very private person,” she urged restraint and understanding from the public.

title: Chinese national quizzed for visiting Kashmir without permission
content: A 29-year-old Chinese tourist faced questioning in Budgam, Kashmir, for unauthorized travel to J&K and Ladakh, violating his visa. He claimed to have visited Zanskar and expressed interest in books about Kashmir. The man, who arrived in Delhi on November 19, flew to Leh without registering, potentially facing deportation.

title: New rules to make drunk-driving checks more reliable from April
content: Starting April, breath analysers will adhere to new consumer affairs department norms, mandating enhanced accuracy and a built-in printer. These updated devices will display only the final BAC result, ensuring verifiable records and reducing misinterpretation. The measures aim to boost public trust in enforcement and improve the efficiency of drunk driving checks.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury update: Cowboys speak out as return timeline unclear
content: Dallas Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer provided an update on CeeDee Lamb's concussion, stating he had a good day but must complete all necessary checks. Lamb sustained the injury during the game against the Detroit Lions. Neuroscientist Dr. Chris Nowinski raised concerns about the severity of the brain injury, sparking fan panic.

title: Russell Wilson’s mom defends him after Trevone Boykin podcast backlash
content: Former NFL player Trevone Boykin sparked debate with comments about Russell Wilson's family holidays. Russell Wilson's mother, Tammy Wilson, publicly defended her son. She clarified family absences and addressed Boykin's remarks directly. Boykin later apologized for his statements. The incident gained significant social media attention.

title: Thermal maps for daily choices: SatLeo tests street-level heat intelligence in Karnataka
content: SatLeo Labs is developing thermal mapping technology using satellite and drone data to provide hyper-local temperature insights. This innovation aims to optimize urban planning, manage outdoor labor conditions, and detect environmental hazards like methane leaks, ultimately making cities cooler and safer for residents and workers.

title: Sources: Colts lose QB Jones to torn Achilles
content: Colts quarterback Daniel Jones suffered a season-ending torn Achilles in the first quarter of Sunday's loss to the Jaguars.

title: Steelers happy to ignore noise, back Tomlin in win
content: Aaron Rodgers completed 23 of 34 attempts for 284 yards with a passing touchdown and a rushing score as the Steelers beat the Ravens 27-22 after a week in which coach Mike Tomlin's job security was in question.

title: Tide, Canes in, Irish out as Indiana tops CFP field
content: Indiana earned the No. 1 seed in the 12-team College Football Playoff field, while Alabama and Miami nudged out Notre Dame for the final at-large spot.

title: Irish say no bowl after CFP snub, rankings 'farce'
content: Notre Dame AD Pete Bevacqua told ESPN that the program is in utter disbelief after being snubbed by the CFP, with the Irish instead not playing in any bowl game this season.

title: Overturned Likely TD among Ravens' ref issues
content: After a critical 27-22 loss to the rival Steelers, many of the Ravens questioned calls made by the referees -- notably an overturned touchdown reception by Isaiah Likely in the fourth quarter -- that ultimately could cost them a chance at the postseason.

title: Browns coach takes blame for failed 2-point try
content: Browns coach Kevin Stefanski accepted blame for a failed 2-point conversion attempt in his team's 31-29 loss to the Titans on Sunday that saw rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders watching from the sideline on the decisive play.

title: Neymar helps Santos stay up, knee surgery next
content: Santos and Neymar secured survival in Brazil's Serie A on Sunday with a 3-0 win over Cruzeiro, and the 33-year-old soccer star later confirmed he will undergo surgery on his left knee.

title: 9-4 Jaguars: Nobody respects us -- 'which is fine'
content: "At the end of the day, I feel like no one likes us except for us," Travis Etienne Jr. said after the Jaguars beat the Colts on Sunday to take control of the AFC South. "We're not going to get their respect. We kind of don't even care."

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: CFP Anger Index: An absurd farce over Notre Dame, Miami
content: Evaluating the committee's ranking process, and what teams should be most upset over in the final CFP ranking.

title: Bills-Pats for AFC East supremacy? Are the Colts toast? We overreact to Week 14
content: Did Josh Allen put Buffalo in position to win its division again? We overreact to Week 14, plus fantasy takes.

title: What could Milwaukee get in a Giannis trade? Our NBA experts propose five offers
content: Giannis paired with Steph Curry? Kevin Durant? Victor Wembanyama?! NBA insiders break down five deals the Bucks could consider.

title: In winning F1 title, Norris proves himself (and his doubters) wrong
content: Lando Norris doubted himself as a title contender earlier this year, but now he can call himself a world champion.

title: Week 14 winners and losers: Josh Allen, Jaxon Smith-Njigba deliver; Jonathan Taylor, Bijan Robinson struggle
content: Josh Allen, Puka Nacua and Jaxon Smith-Njigba led the way with big Week 14 performances, while Jonathan Taylor, Bijan Robinson and Ashton Jeanty were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Fantasy buzz: Injuries pile up in Week 14, as three QBs and Achane, Ertz go down
content: Injuries were problematic with De'Von Achane and Jayden Daniels among the players who left their games early.

title: Salah's Liverpool outburst has echoes of Ronaldo's Man United exit
content: Mohamed Salah appears to have borrowed from Cristiano Ronaldo's playbook: airing frustrations toward his manager that stem from his own poor form.

title: Miami's first MLS Cup title caps off a long, ambitious project
content: A season that started with doubts ends in triumph as Lionel Messi helps steer Inter Miami to their first MLS Cup title.

title: Matsuyama rallies to win Hero Challenge in playoff
content: Hideki Matsuyama won the Hero World Challenge on Sunday when he closed with an 8-under 64 and then hit 9-iron to 2 feet for birdie on the first playoff hole to defeat Alex Noren.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Which prospects stood out in the conference title games?
content: We have NFL draft notes for every week of the college football season, including why Sonny Styles and Zachariah Branch stood out in Championship Week.

title: What's next for new champions Petr Yan and Joshua Van after UFC 323?
content: With Alexandre Pantoja injured, another young talent could be a natural fit to challenge men's flyweight champion Joshua Van.

title: What Buster Olney, Jeff Passan are hearing about Schwarber's suitors, top free agents and blockbuster trades
content: Here's our latest intel heading into the MLB winter meetings, starting with the slugger who holds the key to the offseason.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man Utd target Mouzakitis chooses next club
content: Real Madrid and Manchester United target Christos Mouzakitis has made his choice if he leaves Olympiacos. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Kerala actor rape case: Who all are the accused?
content: The Ernakulam Principal Sessions Judge, Honey M. Varghese, will pronounce the judgment on the day, thus marking the end of one of the prolonged and sensational criminal trials in Kerala.

title: Overhaul of Outer Ring Road to come with tough new quality controls
content: Change is intended to address concerns over contractors using low-quality asphalt, which often leads to potholes and premature road deterioration, say BSMILE officials

title: India inaugurates new state-of-the-art Consulate building in Shanghai
content: Consul General Pratik Mathur in his address reaffirmed the Consulate’s commitment to ensuring seamless services for Indian nationals and Chinese partners

title: How the Kerala actor rape case unfolded: Timeline
content: Nearly nine years after the abduction and assault of a Malayalam actor shook the film industry, the case is nearing a decisive verdict.

title: Chinese national detained; was visiting J&K, Ladakh without permission: Officials
content: A search of his phone history showed that he was looking for the deployment of CRPF in the valley, adding he was being questioned by various agencies

title: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt, wife held for cheating Rajasthan doctor of ₹30 crore
content: Udaipur-based Dr. Ajay Murdia has alleged the filmmaker, along with other accused, duped him by inducements and false assurances of huge profits from film production

title: Missing ‘saroops’ of Guru Granth Sahib: Punjab Police books 16 people
content: The accused included Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC)'s former chief secretary, Roop Singh, and the ex-secretary of the Dharam Parchar Committee, Manjit Singh

title: Assam govt to hand over 992 acres to AAI for Silchar greenfield airport
content: The cabinet approved the transfer of 3,000 bighas at Doloo Tea Estate in Silchar to the AAI for the construction of a greenfield airport, says Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: World becoming more multi-polar makes compelling case for deeper multilateralism: Jaishankar
content: The 20th session of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage will take place at the Red Fort from December 8 to 13.

title: Russian strikes kill 4 in Ukraine as Kremlin praises new U.S. security strategy
content: The document released by the White House said the U.S. wants to improve its relationship with Russia after years of Moscow being treated as a global pariah and that ending the war is a core U.S. interest to "reestablish strategic stability with Russia".

title: Panic grips Assam migrant workers facing eviction in U.P.
content: On December 4, a team from the Lucknow Municipal Corporation led by mayor Sushma Kharkwal arrived to check documents, aiming to identify ‘Bangladeshis and Rohingya’ people living in the area illegally

title: Stone-pelting on Bajrang Dal's procession in Haridwar; heavy police force deployed
content: The Bajrang Dal had organised a 'Shaurya Yatra' in the evening. The procession started from three different locations in Haridwar and the stone-pelting incident took place as soon as it reached Ram Chowk in Jwalapur, the officials said.

title: Voters who participated in Campco society election in a spot
content: With the ink mark still visible, voters fear polling officials may mistake it for the ink used in the local body elections, potentially causing confusion

title: Youth share tales of harassment at PDP meet on why Kashmiri professionals are turning to violence
content: Organised by the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), the conference was attended by the relatives of active militants, youth facing militancy charges and students who get ‘hounded’ outside J&K after militant attacks in Kashmir

title: High-pitched campaign for local body polls ends in Ernakulam
content: Development takes centre stage with the Chief Minister’s recent campaign speech in the city, in which he listed LDF government’s achievements; Congress says his claims are far from reality

title: BJP to raise issues related to scholarships, paddy procurement in Jharkhand Assembly's winter session
content: The needy students are not getting their scholarships. The government is yet to begin the procurement of paddy from farmers. The farmers are being forced to sell their paddy to middlemen at a low price, says Leader of Opposition Babulal Marandi.

title: A black Friday for aviation safety in India
content: The actions by India’s aviation authorities, on December 5, 2025, favouring a private airline, prove that flight safety is still not a serious issue

title: Navy band sets tempo for public concert in Hyderabad
content: Naval Symphonic Band concert, titled Sargam 2025, was held at Navy House, Bolarum, with Telangana Governor Jishnu Dev Varma as chief guest

title: Had no choice but to back BJP in 2019: Dushyant Chautala
content: The BJP has been in power at the Centre for the past 11 years. You know how it runs the government. Do you think we had a choice, asks the former Deputy Chief Minister

title: Australia unveils education reforms, reassures Indian students on safety
content: Indians are among the fastest-growing skilled migrant groups with Hindus and Sikhs from Indian heritage making up nearly 4% of Australia’s population

title: ‘Both Silicon Valley and Washington are in their imperial era’
content: Karen Hao describes a company like OpenAI as “modern-day British East India Company.” “The parallels are extremely stark,” said the award-winning reporter who was in conversation with journalist Samanth Subramanian on Sunday at the Bangalore Literature Festival

title: DGCA gives IndiGo 24-hour ‘final extension’ to respond to show-cause notice
content: IndiGo had sought more time, citing operational constraints arising from the magnitude of disruptions across multiple airports

title: Commuters face inconvenience at temporary Avadi bus terminus
content: A senior official of the CMDA said the modernisation of the bus terminus had been long overdue and has commenced now

title: IndiGo crisis eases after six days; ₹610 crore refunded as govt. tightens oversight
content: On December 7, the airline operated around 1,650 of its scheduled 2,300 domestic and international flights, while 650 remained cancelled; flight disruptions persisted across major airports, though at a reduced scale, with 115 cancellations in Hyderabad, 112 in Mumbai, 109 in Delhi, 38 in Chennai and 11 in Amritsar

title: 25 killed in Goa nightclub fire; four arrested, three officials suspended as CM orders probe
content: The victims included five tourists and 20 staff, including four Nepalis; the club was operating without required licenses, no emergency exit doors; blaze likely caused by pyro guns on the dance floor, police say

title: Chief Minister Stalin to inaugurate mega farm expo in Tiruvannamalai on December 26
content: Revenue officials said that Mr. Stalin will visit the town on December 25-26 where he will chair a meeting with party functionaries in the region on December 25

title: Humayun Kabir seeks alliance with AIMIM, ISF, Left parties, and Congress
content: The suspended TMC MLA, who laid the ‘foundation stone’ for ‘Babri Masjid’ in Beldanga on Dec. 6, said he would launch his party on Dec. 22, and has invited AIMIM’s Asaduddin Owaisi to attend the event

title: National Intelligence Grid slowly gathers pace, receives 45k requests a month
content: The Union Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has asked States to liberally use the platform to access datasets which include details of driving license, Aadhaar registration, airline data, bank records, and also details of social media accounts which share posts on a particular issue.

title: Six dead as car falls into 600-foot gorge in ghat area of Maharashtra's Nashik
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis called the incident "extremely tragic" and said families of the deceased will be provided financial assistance of ₹5 lakh each from the State government

title: Anbumani invites political parties, except DMK, for protest seeking caste survey
content: PMK leader Anbumani claimed a caste-based survey/census is akin to diagnosis of an illness being the first step towards curing a sick person.

title: 10 Maoists surrender in M.P.’s Balaghat; CM Yadav calls on more to lay down arms
content: The development comes a month after a woman Maoist surrendered in Balaghat, becoming the first to lay down arms in Madhya Pradesh

title: Congress, AAP slam Goa government over safety lapses at nightclub; demand CM’s resignation
content: Criminal failure of safety and governance, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi; BJP MLA calls for audit of clubs; Jharkhand Minister demands proper compensation for victims, stern action against culprits

title: A case that shaped the socio-political discourse of Kerala
content: The Women in Cinema Collective, the K. Hema committee, formation of internal complaints committees on film sets and the government’s decision to formulate a film policy are some of the aftermath of the case

title: India needs a diversified portfolio of future-ready power system technologies, say experts
content: Global Energy Leaders Summit moot setting up an inter-State coordination platform for planning and implementing India’s energy roadmap

title: 12 cases of hepatitis A confirmed in Kalamassery in a month
content: Residents have been alerted through WhatsApp about this and advised to follow hygiene practices, says a health dept. official

title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha to protest draft Seeds Bill, alleges it strengthens control of MNCs
content: Farm unions call for burning copies of draft Seeds Bill, say it threatens seed sovereignty and federal rights

title: Woman held while transporting ‘ganja’ thrown from train
content: Drug peddlers resorted to the new method to evade intensified police checks at railway stations, says the police

title: Bhumi puja for two new dialysis centres in West Godavari
content: Mobile cancer screening vehicle worth of Rs.4 crore will soon be deployed in West Godavari, said Mr. Srinivas Varma

title: LDF releases election manifesto for Kozhikode Corporation
content: The new manifesto proposes projects to make Kozhikode an IT hub, including a light metro, continuation of the City Road Improvement Project, development of roads, and a flyover at Eranhipalam

title: Gita chanting event in Kolkata turns into political show of strength for BJP
content: Mass Gita recital at Brigade Parade Ground becomes platform for BJP leaders amid row over mosque foundation in Murshidabad

title: ‘Thilakkam’ takes shine off LDF’s campaign in Kozhikode Corporation
content: ‘Thilakkam’ has landed the LDF in trouble after opposition parties complained that LDF councillors were distributing copies of the progress report to voters during campaigning, violating the poll code

title: Continuance in power helped LDF carry out development works, says Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Kerala CM addresses a campaign event for the upcoming local body elections in Kozhikode; terms initiatives such as eradication of extreme poverty, widening of the NH, and installation of a gas pipeline by GAIL government’s achievements

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: All districts heading for Phase 1 polls ballot-ready, says State Election Commissioner
content: The seven districts going to the polls on December 9 have a little over 1.32 crore voters, including 70.32 lakh female voters, 62.51 lakh male voters and 126 transgender voters. In all, 456 overseas electors are also eligible to vote on Tuesday.

title: Six special trains from Cherlapalli
content: The special trains are being operated to help the passengers stranded due to cancellations of flights

title: Karnataka’s Muzrai Dept. disburses ₹38 lakh to 254 students of priest families; five get ₹1 lakh each for overseas study
content: Data reveals that a substantial majority of beneficiaries are children of priests, who account for 230 out of the 254 students. The remaining 24 beneficiaries are children of temple staff

title: Gujarat teenager pulled out from 140-foot borewell after eight-hour rescue operation, declared dead
content: Police said the primary investigation suggests that Sheikh jumped into the borewell after an argument with his father over renting an expensive mobile phone

title: Serial offender involved in over 50 cases nabbed in Chittoor
content: The accused belonging to Kanyakumari district in Tamil Nadu has over 50 criminal cases registered in TN and one in Chittoor district, say police

title: Waqf Board verifies 10,000, approves 4,000 institutions in the UMEED portal, amid delays
content: More than 33,500 waqf institutions that are gazette-notified were registered till the last day, December 6

title: Details of over 5.17L waqf properties uploads on central site as deadline ends
content: the central portal for management of waqf properties closed for the process on Dec 6 night as per the six-month deadline set out under the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025 . those who failed to upload within the stipulated timeframe will have to now approach the tribunal . the latter, only if convinced of the reasons for delay in uploading details, may give an extension of up to six months .

title: 'Vande Mataram' discussion in Parliament today, sparks set to fly
content: BJP's evocative cultural theme is central to the governing party's political idiom . the debate will take place on the 150th anniversary of Vande Mataram . it will be an extension of the fiery ideological battle between BJP and its opponents over the journey of India's national song .

title: 150 years of Vande Mataram: Why BJP and Congress are fighting over its ‘missing stanzas’ — explained
content: parliament will begin a special discussion in the Lok Sabha on Monday to commemorate 150 years of Vande Mataram . the song remains one of the most debated symbols of India’s freedom struggle . prime minister Narendra Modi will open the debate, with defence minister Rajnath Singh scheduled to conclude it .

title: DGCA give one-time extension to IndiGo CEO & COO to respond to notice
content: Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on PPF Check maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate the pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments

title: How teams' Championship Weekend identities will determine their CFP fate
content: the team that won their matchups won because of the identity they've had all season . the blueprint from the weekend tells us what we need to know . here's what really mattered, why it works and how to think about it from betting perspective .

title: 2025-26 College Football Playoff, bowl schedule
content: the college football season concludes with the most wonderful time of the year -- bowl season . in 2025, that includes the second year of the 12-team college football Playoff . the CFP begins with four first-round games to be played at campus sites Dec. 19 and 20 .

title: What actually matters in every Week 14 game: Statement wins in playoff hunt for Bills, Packers, Steelers
content: quarterbacks exit early due to injuries . quarterbacks left the team's loss to the Jaguars in the first quarter with an Achilles injury . the Seahawks kept the Falcons out of the end zone in a dominant win . in buffalo, the Bills made big defensive plays in the fourth quarter .

title: Duel between Lissies a cause of confusion
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Seahawks put spin on OutKast, Migos album covers to poke fun at Falcons
content: the seahawks outscore the Falcons 31-3 in the second half for a road win . the Seahawks now have three halves this season in which they have outscored opponents by at least 28 points . trolls follow up their post-win graphic with "We're so ATL," then write "Peace Up, A-town down"

title: How all eight teams can win, plus players to watch and biggest questions
content: the college football playoff selection committee's final top 25 of the season produced a 12-team bracket that includes two regular-season rematches in the first round . no. 9 Alabama at No. 8 Oklahoma and no. 11 Tulane at no. 6 Ole Miss beat Alabama, 23-21, on Nov. 15 . the ACC's best team will have a chance to compete for the national title when no. 10 Miami travels to no. 7 Texas A&M .

title: 🏈 Picks for every College Football Playoff game
content: college football's championship weekend delivered a mix of compelling drama and blowouts . UGA, the no. 3 seed, will play the winner of the matchup of no. 6 Ole Miss vs. No. 11 Tulane in the allstate sugar bowl . the real drama was reserved for the Big Ten and ACC championships.

title: Netanyahu Says He Will Meet Trump, 2nd Phase Of Gaza Plan Close
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that he will meet President Donald Trump later this month, saying a second phase of the U.S. president's Gaza plan was close.

title: Netanyahu Says He Will Not Quit Politics If He Receives A Pardon
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that he would not retire from politics if he receives a pardon from the country's president in his years-long corruption trial.

title: 2 Police Officers Killed In Colombia Explosion, Authorities Blame Guerrilla
content: Two police officers were killed Sunday in northeast Colombia in an attack that authorities blamed on the National Liberation Army, a Marxist guerrilla force active since the 1960s.

title: Amid Benin's Coup, A Look At Other Military Takeovers In Africa
content: Benin has joined a growing list of African countries where military officers have seized power since 2020. The military takeover lasted several hours on Sunday before officials announced it was foiled.

title: In Pics: Charred Remains Of Goa Nightclub After Massive Fire Kills 25
content: Several images of the charred 'Birch by Romeo Lane' have surfaced after a massive fire raged through the nightclub in the early hours of Sunday, killing 25 people.

title: 4,500 Police Personnel, 3-Tier Security In Place For Telangana Global Summit
content: A multi-layered security with over 4,500 personnel and advanced technology is being deployed to ensure the safety of officials and international delegates at the Telangana Rising Global Summit 2025 on December 8th and 9th at Meerpet

title: Weeks After Louvre Jewel Heist, Water Leak Damages 400 Egyptian Artifacts
content: A water leak in late November damaged several hundred works in the Louvre's Egyptian department, the Paris museum told AFP on Sunday, weeks after a brazen jewel theft raised concerns over its infrastructure.

title: Case Against Goa Nightclub Owners, Event Organisers After 25 Killed In Fire
content: Police registered an FIR against two owners of Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub in Goa, its manager, and event organisers after a devastating fire claimed 25 lives and detained the sarpanch of Arpora-Nagoa panchayat, a senior official said on Sunday.

title: "I Give Up": Engineering Student Found Dead In Noida Hostel, Say Cops
content: A third-year student at an engineering institute in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar district was found hanging in his hostel room, police said on Sunday.

title: Trumponomics To Gen Z's Rise: Top 10 Trends Of 2025 That Reshaped The World
content: Geopolitical conflicts, the growing influence of artificial intelligence (AI), and a rise in climate disasters like floods and cyclones - the year 2025 saw a lot of shifts globally, for good or bad.

title: 6 Killed As Car Falls Into 600-Foot Gorge In Maharashtra's Nashik
content: Six persons were killed after a car fell into a 600-foot deep gorge in Saptashring Garh Ghat in Nashik's Kalwan taluka on Sunday, a police official said.

title: Post-2019 Kashmir Policy Failed: Mehbooba Mufti Points To Delhi Blast
content: Former Chief Minister and People's Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti has said the Centre's policy on Jammu and Kashmir after the scrapping of Article 370 has failed and urged New Delhi to begin a process of reconciliation.

title: Goa Nightclub Blaze: 3 Senior Government Officials Suspended
content: Three senior officials of the Goa government, including the then Director of Panchayat, were suspended on Sunday in connection with the nightclub fire tragedy for their role in allowing the facility to start operations in 2023, a senior officer said.

title: Major Fire At Assam Fertilizer Plant Days Before PM Modi's Visit
content: A major fire erupted at the ammonia plant of Brahmaputra Valley Fertilizer Corporation Limited in Namrup on Sunday evening, casting shadow over the facility just two weeks before Prime Minister Narendra Modi's expected visit to the area.

title: Victims Killed In Goa Nightclub Fire Identified, 3 Of Them From Delhi Family
content: All 25 victims killed in the Goa nightclub fire tragedy have been identified, including 20 members of the staff and five tourists, authorities said on Sunday night.

title: Donald Trump Avenue In Hyderabad? Bid To Draw Global Eye Ahead Of "Telangana Rising"
content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy has proposed naming a primary road in the city after the President of the United States - a move apparently aimed at grabbing global attention ahead of "Telangana Rising Global Summit".

title: 6 Wild Elephants Stray Onto Haridwar Highway, Chaos Follows
content: Incidents of wild elephants straying into human settlements are on the rise in Uttarakhand's Haridwar district, raising concerns over growing human-wildlife conflict in the region.

title: Andhra Pradesh To Get 6 GW Solar Ingot-Wafer Manufacturing Unit
content: Andhra Pradesh is set to establish an integrated 6 GW solar ingot and wafer production facility in Anakapalli district.

title: Poll Officials To Get Thrashed For Name Deletion: Tripura Congress Leader's Shocker
content: A senior Congress leader from Tripura -- former minister and MLA Sudip Roy Barman - has warned poll officials involved in the voter list revision exercise against electoral malpractices.

title: How much time will Amorim get to build his Man United team?
content: manchester united drew 1-1 with west Ham at old trafford . manager Ruben Amorim has revealed his frustration at the club . the portuguese coach is leading a long-term project at a club which demands short-term success .
